intro: Narcissus homochroos, commonly known as the white narcissus, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its single, white, bowl-shaped flower with a yellow anther. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–50 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil in a sunny location. Its blooms appear in early spring, adding a delicate touch to gardens and natural landscapes. This species is native to southern Europe and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
